sentences.english: Her behaviour became increasingly erratic, and she was often drunk on stage.
sentences.chinese: 她的行爲越來越古怪，有時在舞臺上都是醉醺醺的。

sentences.english: Drunk about the place and capering with Martin's umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 她喝得醉醺醺的，掄着馬丁的雨傘歡蹦亂跳。

sentences.english: Only she hoped that Joe wouldn't come in drunk.
sentences.chinese: 她只希望喬不要醉醺醺地回家來來。

sentences.english: He came home after midnight, and what's moe, he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他後半夜纔回來，而且醉醺醺的。

sentences.english: Her father was too fond of the cup and would lap the gutter at times.
sentences.chinese: 她父親太貪杯了，有時喝得醉醺醺的。

sentences.english: He gets drunk every day and is a real wino.
sentences.chinese: 他每天都喝得醉醺醺的，是個十足的酒徒。

sentences.english: All the officers are drunk, many people began to flatter Jiang choi.
sentences.chinese: 衆軍官都喝得醉醺醺的，不少人就開始吹捧蔣有財。

sentences.english: Whatever. Just get drunk and tell her you love her.
sentences.chinese: 見鬼去吧，不如喝得醉醺醺的，告訴她你愛她。

sentences.english: Later that afternoon, Kugelmass showed up at Persky's drunk.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午晚些時候，庫格麥斯醉醺醺地去了帕斯基家。

sentences.english: He gets drunk every day and is a real wino .
sentences.chinese: 他每天都喝得醉醺醺的，是個十足的酒徒。

definition: variant of 醉醺醺[zui4 xun1 xun1]
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
to get drunk and act crazy/roaring drunk
alcohol drunk to drown one's sorrows
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
